subject: Business
title: S-Curves of Technology Adoption
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: S-Curves of Technology Adoption.

hook.text: Smartphones went from novelty to necessity in about seven years. The curve is always the same shape.

buildup.text: Technology adoption follows an S-curve: slow start, rapid acceleration, and eventual plateau.

discovery.text: The slow start fools incumbents into thinking the threat is small. By the time acceleration hits, it's too late.

twist.text: Companies often invest at the top of one S-curve instead of the bottom of the next one.

climax.text: Successful firms jump to the next S-curve before the current one peaks. Intel did it across chip generations.

punchline.text: Ride the curve up. But start building the next one early.

quiz.question: What mistake do incumbents often make with S-curves?
options: They invest at the top of the current curve instead of the bottom of the next
They adopt new technology too quickly
They always jump to the next curve too early
